Undergraduate Admission






















Undergraduate Admission
At Brown, you have the freedom to study what you choose and discover what you love.



















Undergraduate Admission
At Brown, you have the freedom to study what you choose and discover what you love.









Find the right information for you.
Students
Counselors
Parents & Families
Where will your Brown
education take you?
A Brown University education pushes undergraduates to be creative thinkers, intellectual risk-takers and entrepreneurial problem-solvers.
This distinctive approach demands much of students. As the architect of your education, you are responsible for your own intellectual and creative development. But you also will receive support along the way from a dedicated community of faculty, staff and peer mentors and have access to numerous resources across the University that will help you on your path.
Explore
Visit
Apply




















Discover the
Open Curriculum
At most universities, students must complete a set of core courses. At Brown, we invite you to develop your own personalized course of study. You’ll sample rigorous courses in a wide range of subjects before immersing yourself in one of 80+ academic concentrations (what you might call a major) for in-depth, focused study.
You will graduate from Brown prepared to thrive in whatever path you choose, with the skills, experience and connections to stand out and step up — on the job and everywhere else.

Learn more about The Open Curriculum















The Brown Promise
The world needs intellectually curious people who are driven to have a positive impact, people with a breadth of perspectives and life experiences. Brown actively seeks applicants from diverse backgrounds and offers generous financial aid to support them.
Learn about Financial AidConnect with Brown on social




Join our contact list














Virtual Tour

Take a virtual tour of Brown
One of the best ways to determine if Brown is a good fit is to schedule a campus visit. Get a closer look now by taking a virtual tour — browse real photos of campus and learn interesting facts about this beautiful place we call home.
